meta.property: One Hundred Sixteenth Congress of the United States of America
Authorizing the use of Emancipation Hall for a ceremony as part of the commemoration of the days of remembrance of victims of the Holocaust.

main.name: HCONRES31
main.longTitle: CONCURRENT RESOLUTION Authorizing the use of Emancipation Hall for a ceremony as part of the commemoration of the days of remembrance of victims of the Holocaust.
main.enactingFormula: Resolved by the House of Representatives (the Senate concurring),

section.heading: Use of Emancipation Hall for Holocaust Days of Remembrance ceremony.
section.content: Emancipation Hall in the Capitol Visitor Center is authorized to be used on April 29, 2019, for a ceremony as part of the commemoration of the days of remembrance of victims of the Holocaust. Physical preparations for the ceremony shall be carried out in accordance with such conditions as the Architect of the Capitol may prescribe.

signature.role: Clerk of the House of Representatives.
